item.title: RangeShifter: an eco-evolutionary modelling platform
item.description: As anthropogenic environmental changes accelerate and threaten speciesâ€™ persistence and associated ecosystem services, major tasks for scientists are to predict biological responses to different and interacting pressures, and to design effective management strategies.

item.title: RangeShiftR workshop at IBS 2022
item.description: We’ve been picked to host a RangeShiftR workshop at the IBS 2022 in Vancouver!

item.title: First RangeShiftR workshop - Berlin 2019
item.description: We are proud and exhausted after finishing our first RangeShiftR workshop in Berlin today.

item.title: Project BIOPIC
item.description: Projects using RangeShifter: BIOPIC - Disentangling the effects of demography, dispersal and biotic interactions on population and community response to global change Understanding the interplay between different drivers of biodiversity change is vital for making robust predictions to novel environments.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Here, we feature research papers and other scientific publications using the RangeShifter platform.

item.title: RangeShifter 2.0
item.description: The RangeShifter platform was first published in Bocedi et al. (2014) and new functionality was added in Bocedi et al.

item.title: RangeShiftR
item.description: We here introduce the new RangeshiftR package, which makes RangeShifter 2.

item.title: The RangeShifter team
item.description: The RangeShifter team consists of partners from University of Aberdeen and the University of Potsdam
